You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player who values security and certainty, I would choose the option that guarantees a consistent payoff, even if it's slightly lower than other options. In this case, choosing B ensures a payout of 40$ per round for 75 rounds, totaling 3000$.

If I pick R and my anonymous player chooses B, I lose that round but still have a chance to gain more in the subsequent rounds as my partner might switch their strategy. However, if they stick with their choice, I would earn only 2250$ (75 rounds * 30$).

Similarly, if I pick B and my anonymous player chooses R initially, I could potentially gain more points in future rounds since they have a chance to switch strategies. But again, if they stick with their choice, I would earn only 2625$ (75 rounds * 35$).

By choosing B consistently, I guarantee myself the highest possible payout while minimizing the risk of losing any games. Therefore, my choice would be {B}.
